title: Like an AirTag but slimmer (and rechargeable)
content:
Macworld

Who hasn’t had to tear apart their house like a sleep-deprived raccoon searching for their wallet, keys, or that bag they swear they left by the door? MagTag is the ultra-slim, credit card–sized tracker that slides into your wallet or bag and keeps tabs on your stuff, without bulking up your pockets.

Unlike chunky AirTags that feel like you’re carrying a pebble in your pants, MagTag is just 1.5mm thick. It syncs flawlessly with Apple’s FindMy app, so whether your bag is in your living room or halfway to another continent, you’ll know exactly where it is.

Left something behind? MagTag sends you a heads-up alert before your valuables get too far, and if you’re really scrambling, a loud beep will guide you to victory (or at least your backpack). It even has a built-in keyring hole so you can tag keys, lanyards, or anything else you’re prone to misplacing.

And it’s wirelessly rechargeable and lasts up to 5 months per charge. It’s also IP68 waterproof, so whether you’re caught in a downpour or accidentally drop your wallet in a puddle (again), your MagTag keeps working.

Slimmer than an AirTag, rechargeable, and smart enough to keep your life together.

Grab a MagTag (or two) while it’s on sale for $32.99 (reg. $59.99).
